package.name: sfProjectAnalyserPlugin
package.summary: The sfProjectAnalyserPlugin allows you to analyse your symfony project, it can raise several coding standards alerts. A YAML configuration file allows you to switch what to analyse and also allows you to parameter threshold for each alert.
package.description: The sfProjectAnalyserPlugin allows you to analyse your symfony project, it can raise several coding standards alerts. A YAML configuration file allows you to switch what to analyse and also allows you to parameter threshold for each alert.

release.notes: * Fixed bug when having a module extending a base actions class but not overriding all its methods * Modified the error message when a class is not found

* Add a panel that will show all settings for the analysis * Fixed alert reporting for admin generated modules * Fixed the return code values * Fixed color for ignored objects * Deleted the sfProjectAnanlyserPlugin from the default config * Fixed wrong count of alerts when using the XML output * Fixed the color reporting for modules * Added the possibility to ignore files or objects * Fixed symfony CS ! :-) * Added plugin config controls so the user know its custom config file must be upgraded * Added alert for $this->executeXXX code at action level * Cleanup
* Added a config option 'output' that allows to render the output as XML instead of HTML * Fixed missing files in Package.xml :|

* Fixed the class grouping algorithm * Added a return system error code depending on the results of the analysis * Added a threshold for symfony extended class in order to avoid displaying all classes of a type (mainly for model classes) * Moved the 'plugin_assets_path' to the config plugin section * Added an global option 'plugin_assets_path' to set the path of the plugin's assets * Added a detected value 'all' for the config parameter [plugin][to_parse] to parse all the plugins of the project * Fixed a bug with report generation date * Added a config option for the compat10 mode * Fixed bad warning reporting when using validateXXX methods and the compat1.0 plugin * Fixed parsing of plugins [] = parse of no plugin * Alert for empty application layouts and partials * Alert for application layouts and partials code length * Count of layouts and partials code length of applications * Count of code and templates length by project, application, module * Allowed to switch off alert by putting a false parameter * Allowed to switch code length check to off if parameter is set to false instead of a threshold * Fixed module generic alert count * Fixed colored sections in red when having errors * Added a Javascript folding system to have a cascade display (+ an "expand all" button) * Skip auto-generated modules * Parse activated plugins code

* Added alerts for modules empty templates or partials * Added alerts for too big modules templates or partials * A demo module is now provided, it includes an example of each kind of alert * Added count of modules templates and partials * Refactored the way alerts are processed * Switch percent to two digits * Transfered the TODO list in the README file * Added an alert for functions with "sfContext::getInstance" calls * The parsing of the same named modules into different applications is now possible * Added an alert for functions without docblock * Corrected docblock length calculation
* This is the 1st version of the plugin.
